question: Which of the following is also known as the "Gavrilov's Night"?
explanation: The 2019 Georgian protests, also known as Gavrilov's Night or Protests in Georgia, refers to a series of anti-occupation and anti-government protests in the country of Georgia. It was caused when the Russian MP Sergey Gavrilov visited Georgia within the Interparliamentary Assembly on Orthodoxy and occupied the chair of the speaker of parliament. The protestors used several methods such as demonstrations, civil disobedience and picketing of parliament. These protests lead into the resignation of Irakli Kobakhidze as Chairperson of the Parliament of Georgia and the resignation of Zakaria Kutsnashvili as Member of parliament.
